intro: Adenostyles glabra var. areanosofloccosa, commonly known as the Areno-Sofloccosa variant of the smooth adenostyle, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to dry conditions with its hairy, drought-resistant foliage. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. This variant is of particular interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
